primary.context: Caller wants to sell their timeshare and requested a representative immediately
primary.detail: The caller wanted to sell their timeshare (out of scope) and requested a representative; the transfer failed due to queue unavailability, and the caller eventually hung up.

steps: Agent attempted to collect intent while waiting for a transfer.
Caller stated they wanted to sell their timeshare.
Agent entered a clarification loop regarding renting vs. selling.
Agent initiated transfer to concierge queue.
Caller waited in queue for approximately 25 minutes.
Queue timed out and returned the caller to the AI agent.
Agent informed caller no one was available; caller abandoned.

impediment.detail: The transfer to a live representative failed because no agents were available after a 25-minute wait.

agent_issue.detail: Agent entered a repetitive clarification loop (Turns 11-19) about renting vs. selling even after the user explicitly said 'ownership entirely' and 'no' to renting.

clarifications.note: Asking about renting again after refusal
Asking about selling week vs ownership

corrections.note: User denies selling just the week

loops.subject: renting vs selling
loops.note: Agent repeatedly asks about renting despite user refusals

actions.detail: Transfer to concierge queue timed out after 25 minutes

insights.summary: The caller wanted to sell their timeshare and requested a representative. After a long wait in the queue, the system returned them to the AI because no agents were available, leading to an abandonment.
insights.verbatim: There are no representatives available to take your call right now, so waiting will not connect you with someone.
insights.coaching: The agent should have recognized the 'sell ownership' intent more quickly and avoided the repetitive loop about renting, especially since the user had already requested a representative at the start.
